Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel (joined to EA 66331, 66336 and 66370), the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: Being studied for publication by Bryan Kraemer. Cemeteries and Osireion Excavations Group
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393894) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393894)
